result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathy Lynn Skorie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's JOC

A.D.A. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person pro se.
DPA has been completed successfully, per A.D.A.
The state moves to amend Count 1 to a City of Waupaca ordinance violation for disorderly conduct.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to amended Count 1.
The Court orders a fine of $50.00 plus costs, total:  $267.50, due in 60 days. 
All other counts are dismissed and read in.
Statements by defendant.
Per the Court, the matter is now concluded and the defendant is released from bond.
Review hearing at 06-21-2016 02:30 pm

Deferred Prosecution Agreement - Count 1
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Complete supervision with Waupaca County DHHS
Have no direct or indirect contact with Benjamin Avilez
Have contact with her children in compliance with the rules set by WCDHHS
Submit to, comply with, and complete any counseling, assessments, treatment and/or AODA requested by the social worker and any treatment recommendations
File with Waupaca County DA's office a monthly written report certifying her compliance
Provide DA's office with all necessary written proof of full compliance
If complies - amend to Oridance violation of disorderly conduct with $267.50 due prior to review date
Non-compliance - formal sentencing

A.D.A. Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Genelle Johnson.
Amended information filed as to Count 1.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information and waives reading.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to amended Count 1. 
Plea accepted by the Court, but entry of conviction will be withheld for a period of one year and defendant will be subject to the terms and conditions of the DPA filed today.
All remaining counts are dismissed and read in.
Case will be set for review in one year.
